revised_title: Time-Dependent Electrostatic Probe Theory for Plasma Investigations
tldr: This article presents a time-dependent theory for electrostatic probes, which can be used to study plasma properties, particularly in flame plasmas. The theory relates the charge collected by the probe to the ion density in the plasma and is applicable to various plasmas with similar physical criteria. The authors derive a set of time-dependent partial differential equations, linearize them, and solve them using the Laplace transformation method, providing a solution in the form of a generalized Fourier series. Approximations are made to calculate the free stream ion density from the collected electric charge.
